ygData.subject: Re: Do I ever have a chance at making high level?
ygData.msgSnippet: One comment since when is 50 a hell level? 45 is the ultimat hell level not 50. Naeeldar ... From: James Schuldes  To: eqbards@onelist.com
ygData.messageBody:
One comment since when is 50 a hell level? 45 is the ultimat hell level not
50.

Naeeldar

-----Original Message-----
From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com' <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, December 28, 1999 11:47 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Do I ever have a chance at making high level?


>From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
>
>Greetings Reed and welcome!!
>
>Will leveling get easier? Hmmm - yes and no. Each level higher you get
>takes more xp imho. Some levels are by design twice as hard as regular
>levels - they are called the "Hell" levels: 30, 35, 40 and 45 (imho 50 is
>the ultimate Hell as well) but the teens are real tough for bards as well.
>But it can get easier if you get into groups and if you can form a team
that
>plays together on a regular basis - it will be easier and more fun. You
>should find a guild that you like and that has players who play at your
>level and at your same amount of time in the game. The last time I was
>able to do "a level in a day" was back at level 24 for me. It was hard to
>do even though I could always do it before if I set my mind to it and
>endured long camps.
>
>But I hate camping too! It's dull and boring for the most part.
>Unfortunately, it is a pretty big part of the game as you get older. Most
>bards prefer to group and most groups will want to camp. So, while it may
>be possible to get to high levels without camping, I do think it would take
>a lot longer and it would be a lot harder. But you should play the game
the
>way you are happy with it and don't do stuff that you don't enjoy.
>
>So welcome and please feel free to tell us about your adventures and we are
>happy to help answer your questions ;)
>
>Sylly Songsynger
>Bard of the 40th song
>somewhere on Innoruuk
>
>
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jason Sanderson [mailto:moxy1@...]
> Sent: Monday, December 27, 1999 7:28 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Do I ever have a chance at making
>high level?
>
> From: Jason Sanderson <moxy1@...>
>
> I play a HE 13 level bard, but I am only a part-time player
>(maybe a couple
> hours a week). Lvl 12 took forever and 13 seems to be
>taking longer...
> Will leveling get easier as I get more levels or does it
>take longer for
> each new level? I know that the XP gap gets bigger each
>level, but
> hopefully the better equipment that comes later and a better
>selection of
> mobs make it easier? To make things short, is the easier or
>harder to level
> in the early teens compared to later levels..
> Also, is it impossible to reach high levels without camping?
>I hate
> camping and will not camp for more than 1/2 an hour before I
>get bored and
> leave....
>
> Cheers,
> Reed
> 13 lvl Bard of S Ro..
>
>
> Always carry a flagon of whiskey in case of snakebite and
>furthermore
> always carry a small snake. - W. C. Fields
>
>
>

with the subject submissions.
